issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

While testing out deploying instances on the cloud federated with Shared Setup 1, it was noticed that all instances went immediately to 'terminated' state.
{code}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-2443f303 --region devops-admin@us-east-1
RESERVATION	r-16e5d8c4	001520216600
INSTANCE	i-2443f303	emi-17204b33			terminated	devops-admin	0		m1.xlarge	2015-12-17T03:52:39.203Z	us-east-1a				monitoring-disabled			vpc-246d59ea	subnet-db89d74b	instance-store					hvm							x86_64
{code}
While digging in the logs, the following was noticed in the cloud-debug.log on the CLC:
{code}
Wed Dec 16 19:52:39 2015 DEBUG [DownloadManifestFactory:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation-10.111.1.43-us-east-1a-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#841] Manifest 'DM-emi-17204b33-us-east-1a' does not exist
Wed Dec 16 19:52:39 2015 ERROR [DownloadManifestFactory:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation-10.111.1.43-us-east-1a-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#841] Got an error
javax.crypto.BadPaddingException: unknown block type
        at org.bouncycastle.jcajce.provider.asymmetric.rsa.CipherSpi.engineDoFinal(Unknown Source)
        at javax.crypto.Cipher.doFinal(Cipher.java:1813)
        at com.eucalyptus.imaging.manifest.DownloadManifestFactory.reEncryptKey(DownloadManifestFactory.java:388)
        at com.eucalyptus.imaging.manifest.DownloadManifestFactory.generateDownloadManifest(DownloadManifestFactory.java:243)
        at com.eucalyptus.imaging.manifest.DownloadManifestFactory.generateDownloadManifest(DownloadManifestFactory.java:130)
        at com.eucalyptus.images.Emis$BootableSet.getImageDownloadManifest(Emis.java:333)
        at com.eucalyptus.images.Emis$BootableSet.populateVirtualBootRecord(Emis.java:391)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.Allocations$Allocation.getVmTypeInfo(Allocations.java:444)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.setupVmMessages(ClusterAllocator.java:537)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.<init>(ClusterAllocator.java:266)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.<init>(ClusterAllocator.java:176)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator$SubmitAllocation$1.call(ClusterAllocator.java:218)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator$SubmitAllocation$1.call(ClusterAllocator.java:214)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue$EucaFutureTask.run(Threads.java:696)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue.run(Threads.java:753)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
....
{code}
The EMI is present on the cloud:
{code}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-17204b33 --region devops-admin@us-east-1
IMAGE	emi-17204b33	ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20151214-v2/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000566698318	available	public	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm
{code}
However something triggers this error.  HTTPS has been set up on both clouds, and the HPE trusted root certificate has been added to both clouds. The documentation followed can be found in DOC-1699.

Instances launch successfully on shared setup 1.  The issue is just limited to 'us-east-1' cloud.  

*Setup*

* [Federated Setup in QA|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/QA+Shared+Setups#QASharedSetups-FederatedSetup]
* Attached CFN templates used to create setup on 'us-east-1' cloud.  This tested nested templates.  The main template is in an OSG bucket.  The nested template is the one that calls the VPC template.  Euca2ools commands were executed from CLC of shared setup 1.  Ubuntu EMI was used.  It is publicly available for all cloud users.
fields.summary: "javax.crypto.BadPaddingException: unknown block type" when launching instance on Federated Cloud
fields.environment: 'us-east-1' region on federated setup in QA

{code}
This error generally occurs when the image is bundled using the wrong EC2 certificate for the cloud.

I tested out to see if the certificate was incorrect by bundling an EMI using the cloud-cert.pem from the CLC, and this worked. 
{code}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-install-image -i xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw -b ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-20151217 --arch x86_64 --virtualization-type hvm --name ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-v2 --region devops-admin@us-east-1 --ec2cert us-east-1-cert.pem

[root@d-01 ~]# euform-create-stack --template-file nested-stack-parameters.json --disable-rollback VPCDockerStack --region devops-admin@us-east-1
arn:aws:cloudformation::001520216600:stack/VPCDockerStack/8e209b01-a28b-4b4b-b970-0ba31821ce71
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region devops-admin@us-east-1
RESERVATION	r-98568d2e	001520216600	VPCDockerStack-myStackWithParams-XES9D8X1AT6XD-DockerSecurityGroup-ABFHFULIHSEOD
INSTANCE	i-c8fb28a8	emi-1768c912	euca-10-116-131-8.eucalyptus.c-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-0-0-121.eucalyptus.internal	pending	devops-admin	0		m1.xlarge	2015-12-17T17:28:01.505Z	us-east-1a				monitoring-disabled	10.116.131.8	10.0.0.121	vpc-2e4f8a82	subnet-64d497f6	instance-store					hvm			sg-ab5940a1				x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-8854fff8	subnet-64d497f6	vpc-2e4f8a82	001520216600	in-use	10.0.0.121	euca-10-0-0-121.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		0	attached	2015-12-17T17:28:01.516Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.131.8		10.0.0.121
GROUP	sg-ab5940a1	VPCDockerStack-myStackWithParams-XES9D8X1AT6XD-DockerSecurityGroup-ABFHFULIHSEOD
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	10.0.0.121	euca-10-0-0-121.eucalyptus.internal	primary
{code}
Does this mean that the bootstrap URL for 'us-east-1' region is somehow providing the wrong information?  I checked the cloud certificate on both the CLC and UFS.  Both look correct:
{code}
## cloud cert on CLC ##
[root@b-01 ~]# md5sum /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem
74095ae0e6f3880539f62f10c14ba4bc  /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem

## cloud cert from UFS ##
[root@b-01 ~]# md5sum us-east-1-cert.pem
74095ae0e6f3880539f62f10c14ba4bc  us-east-1-cert.pem
{code}

Is there some other information I can gather that could shed light as to whats going on here?
[~hspencer], how was the image that had the issue installed? (command, environment, host, etc)
[~hspencer], what host did you run the command on?
For the 'euca-admin' user, I ran it on b-01.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.  For 'devops-admin', I ran it on d-01.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.
[~hspencer], so the failing images were bundled on a cloud controller from another cloud?
[~sjones], yes.  I just used the local 'eucalyptus/admin' user on that cloud to bundle, upload and register the images.  Then I modified their launch permissions to make them available to all users.

This seems like the expected behaviour. If installing to a different cloud from a system that has an ec2 X.509 cert available locally use the --ec2cert option with euca-install-image:

{quote}
  --ec2cert FILE        file containing the cloud's X.509 certificate. If one
                        is not available locally it must be available from the
                        bootstrap service.
{quote}

or perhaps I'm misinterpreting what "available locally" means.

[~sjones], I think I am doing a bad job on explaining the issue.  Lemme try again. :-)

Any EMI bundled by the 'eucalyptus/admin' user (using the bootstrap URL), when used with RunInstances immediately terminates with the error mentioned above. I used the CLC of the 'us-east-1' region as the client to run euca-install-image.

The EMI bundled by the 'devops/admin' user works.  Since I saw from the behavior from 'eucalyptus/admin' user using the bootstrap URL, I used the cloud certificate from the CLC of the 'us-east-1' region.  I copied the cloud certificate from the CLC of 'us-east-1' region to the CLC of 'shared-setup-1' region (named it us-east-1-cert.pem), and used the CLC of 'shared-setup-1' region as the client to run euca-install-image.

In addition, I bundled an EMI on the same client (CLC of 'shared-setup-1') not passing --ec2cert (i.e. using boostrap URL), and the instance went to terminated.
{code}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-install-image -i trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw -b ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20151218 --arch x86_64 --virtualization-type hvm --region devops-admin@us-east-1 --name ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-devops

With this behavior, is something wrong with the bootstrap URL to where it causes this issue?

[~hspencer], I'm not sure when the bootstrap URL is used as I'm not clear exactly what it means for the ec2 certificate to be "available locally". I'm also not clear if you are now running the euca-install-image command on the same host for the different users.

[~sjones], 

Nice catch.  I totally forgot about that.  I changed the region to 'euca-us-east-1' and it worked with no problems.

The issue here was that euca2ools has the AWS region 'us-east-1' predefined, and contains a certificate for bundling.  Since it was being referenced via --region, then it was being used with the Eucalyptus region 'us-east-1'.  When I changed this in my euca2ools configuration file, images could be bundled and ran just fine (without specifying --ec2cert).
